text:

Find best restaurants in Ludlow to enjoy appetizing and yummy home cooked food with your family and friends. Our dining area offers fabulous views of our garden like no other restaurants. 
Visiting Ludlow, a thriving medieval town and architectural gem, will offer you many opportunities to sample out the natural scenes, events and festivals, food, as well as the lively community. The disbanding castle walls— a sign of the ancient era, the old half-timbered halls and shops, and the streets dropping down to riverbanks around the medieval town make it one of the best places to explore. Whenever you are in Ludlow, you would like to immerse yourself in delicacies of the town’s fine dining restaurants. The best restaurants in Ludlow can provide you with the best food and menu that will keep your tour experience spruced up. The market square, festivals, medieval Christmas Fayre, the long weekends, good people, and good company make it an exciting place to visit. Ludlow and the surrounding environs have acquired outstanding reputation for bringing quality food and drinks to the people. There are many excellent restaurants that people can dine in and plenty of quality food and drinks to explore. Whether you are going out for an evening dinner to break from the traditional meal plan in your hotel, or you are actually boarding and staying in acclaimed country inn like Baron at Bucknell, you can explore a variety of menus presented by the best chefs. Ludlow’s remarkable reputation for offering fine food may be due to the wonderful fresh local produce, independent butchers, lively markets, specialist food shops, and the amazing themed restaurants and fine dining spots. The Slow Food Ludlow group closely works with the producers of local foods and drinks as well as the restaurant chefs to plan a calendar of events that helps connect the people with places where food comes. Such festival events keep the town busy throughout the year. When you visit Ludlow and your trip coincides with Spring Food Festival in May or the Ludlow Food Festival in September, you are in a better chance to understand how you can truly connect with the local food and drink produces of this area. The trails at Ludlow Food Festival lead you all round to the ancient town to explore bread and sausages from independent butchers as well as bakers, and on your way, you may be able to see the historic buildings of the town as you walk down. At Ludlow, you discover people and places, explore the hills, enjoy the food and ales, and stay in stunning accommodation. Whether you are seeking for a family outing lunch, couples dinner, or a solo dining experience, you can find it in one of the best restaurants in Ludlow . Shropshire Hills area offers an outstanding natural beauty and is a jewel in the lovely countryside of Shropshire. Ludlow, with its abundance of real food and ales, entertainment festivals, eateries, independent shops, and plenty of great walks, this is a travel destination that is justifiably earning a good reputation.
